intro: Sideroxylon lanuginosum subsp. oblongifolium, commonly known as the woolly ironwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woody structure and thick, hairy foliage. The leaves are typically elliptical or oblong in shape, which gives it its subspecies name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are often green or yellowish in color. This plant is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
